content: three shawls three free patterns from kelbourne woolens for the 2025 philly yarn crawl courtney kelley / katelyn lovelace / kate gagnon osborn three shawls garter three free shawl patterns from kelbourne woolens directions using yarns held together co 3 sts next row ws p all sts begin working from charts work row 1 52 of chart a 17 sts work row 1 40 of chart b twice then row 1 18 once more 42 sts work row 1 42 of chart c then row 3 42 once more 22 sts work row 1 64 of chart d 6 sts next row rs decrease k1 ssk k3 5 sts next row ws sl 3 p2 next row decrease ssk k1 k2tog 3 sts bobble all sts finishing weave in ends specifications designer soak in cool water and soak wash and block to kate gagnon osborn measurements yarn kelbourne woolens silk blend no 1 50% wool 30% silk 20% cotton 202 yds/50 gms dark gray 1 skein kelbourne woolens harmony 72% kid mohair 28% mulberry silk 230 yds /25 gms 042 shale 1 skein gauge 16 sts and 28 row = 4 10 cm in diagonal lace patt after blocking needles 1 us 7 4 5 mm 24 60 cm circular or pair straights check your gauge and adjust needle size s accordingly if necessary notions tapestry needle size 10 5 26 5 cm depth 42 5 108 cm at widest point skills simple lace from charts increasing decreasing worthy of note this jaunty little shawl is worked in one piece from point to point in a simple diagonal lace pattern from charts an i cord worked simultaneously with the piece makes for a lovely finished edge but be sure to pay attention to which row to slip and which row to knit as you work the diagonal or straight edge ©2025
